page.title: 20HISTORY OF MARKS TEY
page.content: 1189.It is unusual because during the English Civil War,in 1648,a lot of fighting went on and a cannon ball hit the top of the tower which made it unsafe.So they built the top of it temporarily with wood.The wooden tower is still there.There is a sixteenth century hexagonal font made of lead and wood.There are only 2 others like it in England and Wales. {LITTLE TEY {CHURCH }also dates from{Norman}Times. It is interesting because of its apsidal end.Recently some medieval wall paintings were discovered.They are said to be some of the finest in Essex.They are trying to raise fund to fully restore them. {MARKS TEY HALL} used to be the Manor House of the parish.It was mostly built in the 17th century but parts of it go back much longer,at least as early as 1307. It has a moat,and a priest hiding-hole.
